leaf_cluster.leaf_cluster_name: 生信-系统发育与进化生态
leaf_cluster.task_chain: 比对→建树→模型选择→比较分析→可视化

tools.name: phylostan
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenetic inference using the Stan probabilistic programming language
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that implements phylogenetic models using Stan, allowing for Bayesian inference of phylogenies and evolutionary parameters using Hamiltonian Monte Carlo (HMC) and Variational Inference (VI).

tools.name: physher
tools.one_line_profile: C library and framework for phylogenetic inference
tools.detailed_description: A multi-algorithmic framework written in C for phylogenetic inference, providing tools for maximum likelihood and Bayesian analysis of sequence data.

tools.name: dabestr
tools.one_line_profile: Data Analysis with Bootstrap-coupled ESTimation in R
tools.detailed_description: An R package for data analysis using bootstrap estimation, focusing on effect sizes and estimation plots to move beyond p-values in scientific reporting.

tools.name: kamphir
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenetic inference using tree-shape kernels
tools.detailed_description: An R package for phylogenetic inference using a tree-shape kernel within an Approximate Bayesian Computation (ABC) framework, enabling analysis of tree topologies.

tools.name: pipesnake
tools.one_line_profile: Best-practice pipeline for phylogenomic reconstruction
tools.detailed_description: A Nextflow pipeline for phylogenomic reconstruction from short-read sequencing data, handling steps from quality control to tree inference.

tools.name: BEASTLabs
tools.one_line_profile: Experimental and utility package for BEAST 2
tools.detailed_description: A package for BEAST 2 containing various experimental models, operators, and utilities that extend the core functionality of the BEAST 2 phylogenetic software.

tools.name: phylodynamics
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian phylodynamic methods for BEAST 2
tools.detailed_description: A BEAST 2 package implementing Bayesian phylodynamic models to infer population dynamics from genetic sequence data.

tools.name: IQ-TREE
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient phylogenomic software by maximum likelihood
tools.detailed_description: A fast and effective stochastic algorithm to infer phylogenetic trees by maximum likelihood, including model selection (ModelFinder) and tree validation (Ultrafast Bootstrap).

tools.name: BEAST 2
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian Evolutionary Analysis by Sampling Trees
tools.detailed_description: A cross-platform program for Bayesian analysis of molecular sequences using MCMC. It estimates rooted, time-measured phylogenies using a wide range of substitution and clock models.

tools.name: morph-models
tools.one_line_profile: Morphological models for BEAST 2
tools.detailed_description: A package for BEAST 2 that provides models for performing phylogenetic inference using morphological (discrete) data.

tools.name: sampled-ancestors
tools.one_line_profile: Sampled ancestors package for BEAST 2
tools.detailed_description: A BEAST 2 package providing MCMC proposals and tools for inferring phylogenetic trees that explicitly include sampled ancestors (fossils or time-stamped samples).

tools.name: ColabBEAST
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian Phylogenetic Inference on Google Colab
tools.detailed_description: A notebook-based tool/workflow to facilitate running BEAST 2 phylogenetic analyses on Google Colab infrastructure.

tools.name: hadron
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis tools for lattice QCD
tools.detailed_description: An R package implementing statistical analysis tools specifically for Lattice Quantum Chromodynamics (LQCD) data.

tools.name: PhyLim
tools.one_line_profile: Validation of phylogenetic fitted models
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool to validate whether phylogenetic fitted models are within the limits of inference, assessing model adequacy.

tools.name: JPP
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenetic inference using maximum parsimony
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation for phylogenetic inference using the maximum parsimony criterion.

tools.name: LinguaPhylo
tools.one_line_profile: Probabilistic phylogenetic model specification language
tools.detailed_description: A language and toolkit for describing, visualising, and simulating probabilistic phylogenetic models, facilitating model development and communication.

tools.name: WhereDoGGo
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for prokaryotic phylogenomics
tools.detailed_description: A bioinformatics pipeline designed to place new prokaryotic genomes onto the tree of life using phylogenomic methods.

tools.name: MrBayes
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian inference of phylogeny
tools.detailed_description: A program for Bayesian inference and model choice across a wide range of phylogenetic and evolutionary models.

tools.name: GradME
tools.one_line_profile: Continuous phylogenetic inference using gradients
tools.detailed_description: A tool for continuous phylogenetic inference for rooted and unrooted trees, utilizing gradient-based methods in tree space.

tools.name: MAPLE
tools.one_line_profile: Approximate maximum likelihood phylogenetics
tools.detailed_description: A new approximate approach for maximum likelihood phylogenetics, particularly optimized for short divergence times.

tools.name: snpick
tools.one_line_profile: Fast and memory-efficient SNP extraction tool
tools.detailed_description: A Rust-based tool for extracting SNPs from large genomic alignments with high performance and low memory usage, suitable for phylogenomic preparation.

tools.name: FASconCAT
tools.one_line_profile: Sequence concatenation tool for phylogenetics
tools.detailed_description: A software to concatenate different kinds of sequence data into a supermatrix file (FASTA, PHYLIP, NEXUS) for phylogenetic analysis.

tools.name: coevolve
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian generalized dynamic phylogenetic models
tools.detailed_description: An R package for fitting Bayesian generalized dynamic phylogenetic models using Stan, focusing on coevolutionary analysis.

tools.name: MLLPT
tools.one_line_profile: Maximum likelihood assignment of low-pass samples to trees
tools.detailed_description: A tool for the maximum likelihood assignment of low-pass sequencing samples to existing phylogenetic trees.

tools.name: mulTree
tools.one_line_profile: MCMCglmm on multiple phylogenetic trees
tools.detailed_description: An R package to perform MCMCglmm analyses across multiple phylogenetic trees to account for phylogenetic uncertainty.

tools.name: ROADIES
tools.one_line_profile: Automated inference of species trees from raw genomes
tools.detailed_description: A tool for fully-automated inference of species trees directly from raw genome assemblies, streamlining the phylogenomic workflow.

tools.name: aphylo
tools.one_line_profile: Statistical inference of genetic functions in phylogenetic trees
tools.detailed_description: An R package for statistical inference of genetic functions and annotations within phylogenetic trees.

tools.name: sondovac
tools.one_line_profile: Probe design for target enrichment
tools.detailed_description: A script to create orthologous low-copy nuclear probes from transcriptome and genome skim data for target enrichment in phylogenomics.

tools.name: BEASTIARY
tools.one_line_profile: Real-time MCMC trace monitoring for BEAST
tools.detailed_description: A tool for real-time and remote monitoring of MCMC traces from BEAST analyses, providing visualization of convergence and mixing.

tools.name: episodic
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for episodic molecular clock models
tools.detailed_description: A complete pipeline for fitting and testing Fixed Local Clock (FLC) molecular clock models to detect episodic evolution.

tools.name: ancseq
tools.one_line_profile: Wrapper tool for ancestral sequence and indel reconstruction using IQ-TREE
tools.detailed_description: A Python wrapper that facilitates ancestral sequence reconstruction and insertion/deletion (indel) reconstruction by leveraging the capabilities of IQ-TREE. It automates the process of inferring ancestral states on phylogenetic trees.

tools.name: robmed
tools.one_line_profile: Fast and robust mediation analysis methods
tools.detailed_description: An R package that performs mediation analysis using a fast-and-robust bootstrap test. It provides methods to estimate indirect effects and test their significance, robust to outliers and deviations from normality.

tools.name: ExaBayes
tools.one_line_profile: Massively parallel Bayesian tree inference
tools.detailed_description: A software package for Bayesian phylogenetic inference, designed to scale to massive datasets using parallel computing (MPI). It implements Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) methods for inferring phylogenetic trees and parameters.

tools.name: beast2-xml
tools.one_line_profile: Python utility to generate BEAST2 XML configuration files
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed to programmatically generate XML input files for the BEAST2 phylogenetic software, facilitating the automation of simulation studies and complex analysis setups.

tools.name: phylogenomics_pipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for phylogenomic inference using single-copy nuclear genes
tools.detailed_description: A set of Perl scripts for phylogenomic analysis, specifically designed to infer phylogenies using four-fold degenerate sites (4DTvs) of combined single-copy nuclear genes after OrthoFinder clustering.

tools.name: Phydelity
tools.one_line_profile: Inference of putative transmission phylogenetic clusters
tools.detailed_description: A tool for the inference of putative transmission clusters from phylogenetic trees, often used in epidemiological studies to identify related viral sequences.

tools.name: RAxML-NG
tools.one_line_profile: Fast, scalable, and user-friendly maximum likelihood phylogenetic inference
tools.detailed_description: The next generation of the RAxML software for phylogenetic tree inference using Maximum Likelihood. It offers improved speed, scalability, and flexibility compared to its predecessor, supporting a wide range of evolutionary models.

tools.name: phylo
tools.one_line_profile: Variational Combinatorial Sequential Monte Carlo for phylogenetics
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of Variational Combinatorial Sequential Monte Carlo (VCSMC) methods for Bayesian Phylogenetic Inference, providing an alternative to standard MCMC for exploring tree space.

tools.name: beast2_constsites
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to update BEAST2 XMLs for constant sites
tools.detailed_description: A utility script to modify BEAST2 XML configuration files to correctly account for constant sites (invariant sites) in the alignment, which is crucial for accurate branch length and substitution rate estimation.

tools.name: PCAtest
tools.one_line_profile: Statistical significance testing for PCA
tools.detailed_description: An R package for evaluating the statistical significance of Principal Component Analysis (PCA) results. It helps select the number of significant PC axes and tests the contributions of variables using permutation strategies.

tools.name: Beluga.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Statistical analysis of gene family evolution and WGD inference
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package for the statistical analysis of gene family evolution using phylogenetic birth-death processes. It includes methods for inferring Whole Genome Duplications (WGD) using reversible jump MCMC.

tools.name: Whale.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian gene tree reconciliation and WGD inference
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package for Bayesian gene tree reconciliation and Whole Genome Duplication (WGD) inference using Amalgamated Likelihood Estimation (ALE).

tools.name: mutree
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenetic tree inference and mutation recurrence discovery
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline that combines phylogenetic tree inference with the discovery of recurrent mutations, useful for understanding evolutionary trajectories and mutation patterns.

tools.name: PhylogenomicsPipelines
tools.one_line_profile: Pipelines for phylogenomic analysis
tools.detailed_description: A collection of pipelines designed to perform phylogenomic analyses, likely automating steps such as alignment, trimming, and tree building for genomic datasets.

tools.name: BEAST
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian Evolutionary Analysis Sampling Trees (BEAST 1)
tools.detailed_description: A cross-platform program for Bayesian analysis of molecular sequences using MCMC. It is used to estimate phylogenies, divergence times, and evolutionary parameters.

tools.name: Tracer
tools.one_line_profile: Posterior summarisation and visualization for Bayesian phylogenetics
tools.detailed_description: A graphical tool for analyzing the trace files generated by Bayesian MCMC phylogenetics software (like BEAST). It allows users to visualize posterior distributions, assess mixing (ESS), and estimate marginal likelihoods.

tools.name: beast-phylonco
tools.one_line_profile: BEAST2 package for single-cell cancer evolution
tools.detailed_description: An add-on package for BEAST2 specifically designed to model and infer the evolutionary history of cancer cells from single-cell sequencing data.

tools.name: resampling
tools.one_line_profile: Python module for jackknife and bootstrap resampling
tools.detailed_description: A Python library providing functions for statistical resampling methods, including jackknife and bootstrap, which are commonly used for error estimation in scientific data analysis.

tools.name: CVtreeMLE
tools.one_line_profile: Cross Validated Decision Trees with Targeted Maximum Likelihood Estimation
tools.detailed_description: An R package implementing Cross-Validated Decision Trees combined with Targeted Maximum Likelihood Estimation (TMLE) for robust statistical inference and causal effect estimation.

tools.name: bnkit
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian network toolkit for phylogenetic analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Java toolkit for Bayesian network learning and inference, with specific applications and extensions for phylogenetic analysis, including ancestral reconstruction and co-evolution detection.

tools.name: PIQMEE
tools.one_line_profile: BEAST2 add-on for duplication-loss-coalescence modeling
tools.detailed_description: A BEAST2 package that implements a model for inferring gene family evolution using a duplication-loss-coalescence framework, allowing for the integration of gene tree and species tree inference.

tools.name: delphy
tools.one_line_profile: Fast and scalable Bayesian phylogenetics
tools.detailed_description: A software tool designed for fast, scalable, and accurate Bayesian phylogenetic inference, aiming to make advanced Bayesian methods accessible for large datasets.

tools.name: TreeMix-Pipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for TreeMix analysis with bootstrapping and consensus
tools.detailed_description: A set of R scripts to automate the usage of TreeMix, including bootstrapping, selection of migration events, consensus tree creation, and visualization of residuals and drift.

tools.name: scSomMerClock
tools.one_line_profile: Molecular clock test for single-cell DNA sequencing data
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool to test for the presence of a molecular clock in phylogenetic trees inferred from single-cell DNA sequencing data, useful for cancer evolution studies.

tools.name: dna_stats_app
tools.one_line_profile: Browser-based interactive genomics dashboard
tools.detailed_description: A web-based tool allowing users to perform sequence alignment, phylogenetic tree inference, conservation profiling, and motif searching directly in the browser.

tools.name: VeryFastTree
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance phylogenetic tree inference
tools.detailed_description: An optimized version of FastTree designed for efficient phylogenetic tree inference on massive taxonomic datasets, leveraging parallelization and algorithmic improvements.

tools.name: clockor2
tools.one_line_profile: Inference of global and local strict molecular clocks
tools.detailed_description: A tool for inferring global and local strict molecular clocks using root-to-tip regression analysis, helping to estimate evolutionary rates and divergence times.

tools.name: sprspace
tools.one_line_profile: Quantifying MCMC exploration of SPR tree space
tools.detailed_description: A collection of scripts to analyze and quantify how well MCMC chains explore the Subtree Prune-and-Regraft (SPR) tree space in Bayesian phylogenetic inference (specifically MrBayes posteriors).

tools.name: phyr
tools.one_line_profile: R functions for phylogenetic analyses
tools.detailed_description: An R package providing a suite of functions for phylogenetic comparative methods and other phylogenetic analyses, facilitating the integration of phylogenies into statistical models.

tools.name: OrthoFinder
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenetic orthology inference for comparative genomics
tools.detailed_description: A leading software for phylogenetic orthology inference. It infers orthogroups, gene trees, species trees, and orthologs/paralogs from proteomes, serving as a foundation for comparative genomics.

tools.name: MPBoot
tools.one_line_profile: Fast maximum parsimony tree inference and bootstrap
tools.detailed_description: A software for fast phylogenetic tree inference using the Maximum Parsimony criterion. It implements an efficient bootstrap approximation method to assess branch support rapidly.

tools.name: mcmc-date
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenetic dating using multivariate normal approximation
tools.detailed_description: A tool to estimate node ages of a phylogeny by approximating the phylogenetic likelihood with a multivariate normal distribution, offering a faster alternative to full Bayesian dating for certain problems.

tools.name: PhyloSD
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenomic Subgenome Detection pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline designed for the detection of subgenomes in allopolyploids using phylogenomic data, helping to disentangle complex evolutionary histories in polyploid organisms.

tools.name: PhySigs
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenetic inference of mutational signature exposures
tools.detailed_description: A method for inferring the exposures of mutational signatures along the branches of a phylogenetic tree, enabling the study of how mutational processes change over evolutionary time.

tools.name: modeltest_phylo
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for phylogenetic model selection and reconstruction
tools.detailed_description: A shell-based pipeline that integrates model selection tools (jModelTest, ProtTest) with phylogenetic reconstruction software (PhyML, RAxML) and topology comparison (CONSEL) to streamline phylogenetic analysis.

tools.name: BDEI
tools.one_line_profile: Inference of BDEI epidemiological model parameters from trees
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for inferring the parameters of a Birth-Death Exposed-Infectious (BDEI) model directly from phylogenetic trees, linking phylodynamics with epidemiological modeling.

tools.name: fasttrees
tools.one_line_profile: Fast and frugal tree classifier for sklearn
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of 'fast and frugal trees' (simple decision trees) compatible with scikit-learn. While a general ML tool, it implements a specific cognitive/statistical model used in decision science and data analysis.

tools.name: HomBlocks
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for organelle phylogenomics alignment
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline for constructing multiple alignments for organelle phylogenomics. It identifies locally collinear blocks to handle rearrangements and creates datasets for phylogenetic inference.

tools.name: contraband
tools.one_line_profile: BEAST2 package for continuous trait evolution
tools.detailed_description: A BEAST2 package that implements Brownian motion models for the study of continuous trait evolution on phylogenetic trees, allowing for the integration of phenotypic data with molecular phylogenetics.

tools.name: TreeSort
tools.one_line_profile: Virus reassortment inference software using molecular clock constraints
tools.detailed_description: TreeSort is a software tool designed for inferring both recent and ancestral virus reassortment events. It utilizes flexible molecular clock constraints to analyze phylogenetic discrepancies, aiding in the understanding of viral evolution and reassortment dynamics.

tools.name: rf-net-2
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenetic network inference for reassortment detection
tools.detailed_description: rf-net-2 is a tool for inferring phylogenetic networks specifically to detect reassortment events. It is designed to work with viral genomic data to reconstruct evolutionary histories involving reticulate events.

tools.name: pairdist
tools.one_line_profile: Neighbor-joining tree construction from pairwise ML distances
tools.detailed_description: pairdist is a utility that creates a neighbor-joining phylogenetic tree from a set of sequences. It calculates maximum likelihood distances based on pairwise sequence alignments to construct the tree.

tools.name: TeddyPi
tools.one_line_profile: Transposable Element detection and discovery for Phylogenetic inference
tools.detailed_description: TeddyPi (Transposable Element detection and discovery for Phylogenetic inference) is a pipeline designed to leverage transposable element data for phylogenetic reconstruction, offering an alternative or complementary marker system to standard sequence data.

tools.name: IQ-TREE 2
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient software for phylogenomic inference using maximum likelihood
tools.detailed_description: IQ-TREE 2 is a widely used software for efficient phylogenomic inference. It implements maximum likelihood methods for tree reconstruction, model selection (ModelFinder), and tree validation (Ultrafast Bootstrap), handling large datasets with high performance.

tools.name: IQ-TREE 3
tools.one_line_profile: Next-generation version of the IQ-TREE phylogenetic software
tools.detailed_description: IQ-TREE 3 is the development version of the IQ-TREE software suite, continuing the focus on fast and accurate maximum likelihood phylogenetic inference with new features and optimizations.

tools.name: piqtree
tools.one_line_profile: Python library interface for IQ-TREE functionalities
tools.detailed_description: piqtree is a Python library that exposes the core features of IQ-TREE, allowing developers and researchers to integrate efficient phylogenomic inference capabilities directly into Python-based workflows and tools.

tools.name: orthogarden
tools.one_line_profile: ML phylogenetic inference for non-model organisms
tools.detailed_description: orthogarden is a machine learning-based tool for phylogenetic inference, specifically tailored for non-model organisms using short reads and assemblies. It aims to facilitate phylogenomics in species with limited genomic resources.

tools.name: BUSCO_phylogenomics
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline to construct species phylogenies using BUSCO proteins
tools.detailed_description: BUSCO_phylogenomics is a utility script and pipeline that automates the construction of species phylogenies by extracting and aligning BUSCO (Benchmarking Universal Single-Copy Orthologs) proteins from genomic data.

tools.name: which_tree
tools.one_line_profile: Testing framework for phylogenetic inference methods
tools.detailed_description: which_tree is a tool designed for testing and comparing different phylogenetic inference methods. It helps researchers evaluate the performance and accuracy of various tree-building algorithms.

tools.name: vbsky
tools.one_line_profile: Variational Bayesian skyline for inferring evolutionary models
tools.detailed_description: vbsky implements a Variational Bayesian skyline approach to infer evolutionary models and population history from large phylogenetic datasets, offering a computationally efficient alternative to standard MCMC methods.

tools.name: orthoscope
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic tool for phylogenetic inference of orthogroups
tools.detailed_description: Orthoscope is an automatic tool (often deployed as a web service) for the phylogenetic inference of animal and plant orthogroups, designed to handle purposeful taxonomic sampling for evolutionary studies.

tools.name: quicktree
tools.one_line_profile: Fast implementation of the neighbor-joining algorithm
tools.detailed_description: QuickTree is a highly efficient implementation of the Neighbor-Joining algorithm for phylogenetic tree reconstruction, capable of handling large sets of sequences rapidly.

tools.name: AMPHORA
tools.one_line_profile: Automated Phylogenomic Inference Pipeline
tools.detailed_description: AMPHORA is an automated pipeline for phylogenomic inference that uses protein marker genes to assign phylogenetic taxonomy to metagenomic sequence data.

tools.name: bdskytools
tools.one_line_profile: R functions for Birth-Death Skyline (BDSKY) analysis in BEAST2
tools.detailed_description: bdskytools is an R package providing functions to read, process, and plot the results of Birth-Death Skyline (BDSKY) analyses run in BEAST2, facilitating the interpretation of epidemiological and evolutionary dynamics.

tools.name: beastio
tools.one_line_profile: R package for pre- and post-processing of BEAST files
tools.detailed_description: beastio is an R package designed to assist with the input and output processing for BEAST and BEAST2 software, helping users manage configuration files and analyze output logs.

tools.name: nidhoggr
tools.one_line_profile: Snakemake pipeline for phylogenetic tree inference
tools.detailed_description: nidhoggr is a Snakemake-based pipeline that automates the process of phylogenetic tree inference, managing steps from alignment to tree building to ensure reproducibility and scalability.

tools.name: PhyloHerb
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenomic analysis pipeline for Herbarium specimens
tools.detailed_description: PhyloHerb is a phylogenomic analysis pipeline specifically optimized for processing data from herbarium specimens, addressing challenges associated with degraded DNA and historical samples.

tools.name: NetRAX
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenetic Network Inference without ILS
tools.detailed_description: NetRAX is a C++ tool for inferring phylogenetic networks. It focuses on scenarios without Incomplete Lineage Sorting (ILS), providing methods for reconstructing reticulate evolutionary histories.

tools.name: evolnets
tools.one_line_profile: R package to reconstruct ancestral networks from RevBayes output
tools.detailed_description: evolnets is an R package designed to process output from RevBayes, specifically for reconstructing and visualizing ancestral networks inferred during Bayesian phylogenetic analysis.

tools.name: GCtree
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenetic inference of genotype-collapsed trees
tools.detailed_description: GCtree is a tool for the phylogenetic inference of genotype-collapsed trees, often used in B-cell receptor lineage analysis to handle identical sequences and abundance data.

tools.name: linearham
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian Phylo-HMM for B cell receptor sequence analysis
tools.detailed_description: linearham is a Bayesian Phylogenetic Hidden Markov Model (Phylo-HMM) tool designed for the analysis of B cell receptor (BCR) sequences, integrating VDJ recombination and somatic hypermutation models.

tools.name: Phyla
tools.one_line_profile: Foundation Model for Phylogenetic Inference
tools.detailed_description: Phyla is an AI-based foundation model designed for phylogenetic inference. It leverages deep learning techniques to learn evolutionary patterns and assist in constructing phylogenetic trees.

tools.name: FastTree 2
tools.one_line_profile: Approximately-Maximum-Likelihood Trees for Large Alignments
tools.detailed_description: FastTree 2 is a standard tool for inferring approximately-maximum-likelihood phylogenetic trees from very large alignments. It is known for its speed and scalability compared to traditional ML methods.

tools.name: FastDTLmapper
tools.one_line_profile: Genome-wide gene gain/loss mapping using DTL reconciliation
tools.detailed_description: FastDTLmapper is a tool for mapping gene gain and loss events across a genome using the Duplication-Transfer-Loss (DTL) reconciliation method, aiding in the study of gene family evolution.

tools.name: beagle_optimiser
tools.one_line_profile: Optimizer for BEAST/MrBayes BEAGLE library settings
tools.detailed_description: beagle_optimiser is a utility that benchmarks different BEAGLE library configurations for a given BEAST or MrBayes input file to determine the settings that yield the shortest analysis time.

tools.name: TreeTime
tools.one_line_profile: Maximum likelihood inference of time stamped phylogenies
tools.detailed_description: TreeTime is a tool for maximum likelihood inference of time-stamped phylogenies and ancestral reconstruction. It is widely used for viral evolution analysis to estimate molecular clocks and date ancestral nodes.

tools.name: CoalRe
tools.one_line_profile: BEAST2 implementation of the coalescent with reassortment
tools.detailed_description: CoalRe is a package for the BEAST2 software that implements a coalescent model incorporating reassortment, allowing for the inference of evolutionary parameters in segmented viruses.

tools.name: CoupledMCMC
tools.one_line_profile: Adaptive parallel tempering for BEAST2
tools.detailed_description: CoupledMCMC is a BEAST2 package that implements adaptive parallel tempering (MC3), improving the mixing and convergence of MCMC chains for complex phylogenetic models.

tools.name: Mascot
tools.one_line_profile: Structured coalescent approximation for BEAST2
tools.detailed_description: Mascot is a BEAST2 package that implements an approximation of the structured coalescent (Marginal Approximation of the Structured COalescenT), enabling efficient inference of migration rates and population dynamics.

tools.name: Recombination
tools.one_line_profile: BEAST2 package to model recombination
tools.detailed_description: Recombination is a package for BEAST2 designed to model recombination events within the phylogenetic framework, extending the capabilities of standard coalescent analysis.

tools.name: BEASTmasteR
tools.one_line_profile: R code for generating BEAST2 XML configuration files
tools.detailed_description: BEASTmasteR is an R tool for programmatically generating complex XML input files for BEAST2, with a focus on morphology and tip-dating analyses which are difficult to configure manually.

tools.name: BioGeoBEARS
tools.one_line_profile: BioGeography with Bayesian and likelihood Evolutionary Analysis
tools.detailed_description: BioGeoBEARS is an R package for performing historical biogeography analysis. It allows for probabilistic inference of ancestral ranges on a phylogeny using various models (DEC, DIVA, BAYAREA).

tools.name: Burntrees
tools.one_line_profile: Scripts for manipulating phylogenetic MCMC output
tools.detailed_description: Burntrees is a collection of Perl scripts for processing and manipulating the output trees from phylogenetic MCMC software like MrBayes and BEAST, facilitating burn-in removal and tree summarization.

tools.name: catfasta2phyml
tools.one_line_profile: Concatenates FASTA files to PHYLIP format
tools.detailed_description: catfasta2phyml is a utility script that concatenates multiple FASTA formatted sequence files into a single PHYLIP formatted alignment file, a common preprocessing step for phylogenetic software like PhyML.

tools.name: snvphyl-galaxy
tools.one_line_profile: Galaxy wrapper for SNVPhyl phylogenomics pipeline
tools.detailed_description: snvphyl-galaxy provides the Galaxy tool wrappers for the SNVPhyl pipeline, enabling users to run whole-genome single nucleotide variant (SNV) phylogenomics analyses within the Galaxy platform interface.

tools.name: snvphyl-tools
tools.one_line_profile: Core tools for the SNVPhyl phylogenomics pipeline
tools.detailed_description: snvphyl-tools contains the underlying scripts and utilities used by the SNVPhyl pipeline for tasks such as variant calling, alignment generation, and tree building from whole-genome sequencing data.

tools.name: bito
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance library for Bayesian phylogenetics via optimization
tools.detailed_description: bito is a C++ library with a Python interface designed for high-performance gradient-based optimization in Bayesian phylogenetics. It serves as a computational engine for inferring tree structures and evolutionary parameters.

tools.name: Orthoflow
tools.one_line_profile: Workflow for phylogenetic inference of genome-scale datasets
tools.detailed_description: Orthoflow is a workflow designed for phylogenetic inference using genome-scale datasets of protein-coding genes. It orchestrates the process of orthology inference, alignment, and tree building.

tools.name: splace
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to split, align and concatenate gene sequences for phylogenetics
tools.detailed_description: Splace is a utility tool designed to prepare datasets for phylogenetic inference by splitting, aligning, and concatenating gene sequences.

tools.name: phylociraptor
tools.one_line_profile: Rapid and customizable phylogenomic tree calculation framework
tools.detailed_description: Phylociraptor is a highly customizable framework for reproducible phylogenomic inference, designed to streamline the calculation of phylogenetic trees from genomic data.

tools.name: RevGadgets
tools.one_line_profile: Postprocessing tools for RevBayes output
tools.detailed_description: RevGadgets is an R package containing tools for processing and visualizing the output generated by the Bayesian phylogenetic inference software RevBayes.

tools.name: RevGadgets_old
tools.one_line_profile: Legacy postprocessing tools for RevBayes output
tools.detailed_description: This is the older version of the RevGadgets R package, used for processing and visualizing RevBayes output.

tools.name: Revticulate
tools.one_line_profile: R interface for interacting with RevBayes
tools.detailed_description: Revticulate is an R library that allows users to call functions and interact with RevBayes directly from the R environment.

tools.name: RevBayes
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian phylogenetic inference using graphical models
tools.detailed_description: RevBayes is a software package for Bayesian phylogenetic inference using graphical models and an interactive model-specification language.

tools.name: revbayes_kernel
tools.one_line_profile: Jupyter kernel for RevBayes
tools.detailed_description: A Jupyter kernel that enables the execution of RevBayes code within Jupyter notebooks, facilitating interactive analysis and documentation.

tools.name: babette
tools.one_line_profile: R package to work with BEAST2
tools.detailed_description: babette is an R package designed to interface with BEAST2, allowing users to set up, run, and analyze BEAST2 phylogenetic analyses from R.

tools.name: beastier
tools.one_line_profile: R package to run BEAST2
tools.detailed_description: beastier is an R package that provides functions to call and run BEAST2 directly from the R environment.

tools.name: beautier
tools.one_line_profile: R package to generate BEAST2 XML parameter files
tools.detailed_description: beautier is an R package that generates BEAST2 XML input files programmatically, mimicking the functionality of the BEAUti GUI.

tools.name: tracerer
tools.one_line_profile: R package to parse and analyze BEAST2 output
tools.detailed_description: tracerer is an R package that parses and analyzes the log and tree files produced by BEAST2, acting as a programmatic alternative to the Tracer software.

tools.name: tidetree
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian phylogenetic framework for single-cell lineage tracing
tools.detailed_description: tidetree is a Bayesian phylogenetic framework designed to estimate single-cell trees and population dynamic parameters from genetic lineage tracing data.

tools.name: pyjar
tools.one_line_profile: Joint ancestral state reconstruction algorithm implementation
tools.detailed_description: pyjar is a Python implementation of the joint ancestral state reconstruction algorithm described by Pupko et al.

tools.name: rapidNJ
tools.one_line_profile: Fast Neighbour-Joining method for phylogenetic inference
tools.detailed_description: rapidNJ is a high-performance implementation of the Neighbour-Joining method, enabling rapid phylogenetic inference on large datasets.

tools.name: Phyling
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenetic inference from annotated genomes
tools.detailed_description: Phyling is a tool for performing phylogenetic inference directly from annotated genome sequences, automating marker selection and tree building.

tools.name: ExaML
tools.one_line_profile: Exascale Maximum Likelihood code for phylogenetic inference
tools.detailed_description: ExaML is a code for phylogenetic inference using the Maximum Likelihood method, optimized for exascale computing environments using MPI.

tools.name: PhyML
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenetic estimation using Maximum Likelihood
tools.detailed_description: PhyML is a widely used software package for phylogenetic estimation using the Maximum Likelihood principle, supporting various models of DNA and protein evolution.

tools.name: MBASR
tools.one_line_profile: MrBayes Ancestral States with R
tools.detailed_description: MBASR is an R-based tool designed to facilitate ancestral state reconstruction using MrBayes.

tools.name: aPhyloGeo-pipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogeographic workflow using sliding-windows
tools.detailed_description: aPhyloGeo-pipeline is a phylogeographic workflow that utilizes sliding-window analysis, RAxML-NG, and FastTree to investigate genetic variation across geography.

tools.name: get_phylomarkers
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline to select optimal markers for microbial phylogenomics
tools.detailed_description: get_phylomarkers is a pipeline for selecting optimal genetic markers for microbial phylogenomics and species tree estimation, supporting multispecies coalescent and concatenation approaches.

tools.name: phylopipe
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline to build massive trees from global data
tools.detailed_description: phylopipe is a Nextflow pipeline designed to construct massive phylogenetic trees from global viral datasets.

tools.name: diffsel
tools.one_line_profile: Detect convergent evolution using Bayesian phylogenetic codon models
tools.detailed_description: diffsel is a C++ program that uses Bayesian phylogenetic codon models to detect signatures of convergent evolution in sequence data.

tools.name: ChromoSSE
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenetic models of chromosome evolution
tools.detailed_description: ChromoSSE implements phylogenetic models for studying chromosome number evolution and chromosomal rearrangements.

tools.name: AMPHORA2
tools.one_line_profile: Automated Phylogenomic Inference Pipeline for Bacteria and Archaea
tools.detailed_description: AMPHORA2 is an automated pipeline for phylogenomic inference, specifically designed for analyzing bacterial and archaeal sequences.

tools.name: Phyla_AMPHORA
tools.one_line_profile: Phylum-specific Automated Phylogenomic Inference Pipeline
tools.detailed_description: Phyla_AMPHORA is a specialized version of the AMPHORA pipeline, tailored for phylum-specific phylogenomic inference in bacteria.

tools.name: BactDating
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian inference of ancestral dates on bacterial phylogenetic trees
tools.detailed_description: BactDating is an R package for performing Bayesian inference of ancestral dates and evolutionary rates on bacterial phylogenetic trees.

tools.name: VEHoP
tools.one_line_profile: Versatile Homology-based Phylogenomic pipeline
tools.detailed_description: VEHoP is a versatile and easy-to-use pipeline for homology-based phylogenomic inference, accommodating DNA, RNA, and protein sequences.

tools.name: PhyloInfer
tools.one_line_profile: Library for efficient Bayesian phylogenetic inference methods
tools.detailed_description: PhyloInfer is a Python library focused on developing and implementing efficient methods for Bayesian phylogenetic inference, often using variational inference.

tools.name: sbn
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenetic Posterior Estimator via subsplit Bayesian networks
tools.detailed_description: This tool implements a method for generalizing phylogenetic posterior estimators from MCMC samples using subsplit Bayesian networks.

tools.name: vbpi-gnn
tools.one_line_profile: Learnable topological features for phylogenetic inference via GNN
tools.detailed_description: vbpi-gnn provides code for learning topological features for phylogenetic inference using Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) within a Variational Bayesian framework.

tools.name: vbpi-nf
tools.one_line_profile: Variational Bayesian phylogenetic inference with normalizing flows
tools.detailed_description: vbpi-nf implements improved Variational Bayesian Phylogenetic Inference (VBPI) using normalizing flows to better approximate posterior distributions.

tools.name: SynNet-Pipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Workflow for Building Microsynteny Networks
tools.detailed_description: SynNet-Pipeline is a workflow designed for constructing and analyzing microsynteny networks from genomic data.

tools.name: PhyloGFN
tools.one_line_profile: Phylogenetic inference with generative flow networks
tools.detailed_description: PhyloGFN is an implementation of Generative Flow Networks (GFlowNets) applied to the problem of phylogenetic inference.

tools.name: GARLI
tools.one_line_profile: Genetic Algorithm for Rapid Likelihood Inference
tools.detailed_description: GARLI is a software package for phylogenetic inference that uses a genetic algorithm to find the maximum likelihood tree.
